meanings.definition: One who complains habitually or constantly.
meanings.sent1: The kvetcher in our office always finds something to complain about.
meanings.sent2: My grandmother is a kvetcher who never seems satisfied with anything.
meanings.sent3: The kvetcher at the restaurant kept sending her food back, claiming it was too cold.
meanings.sent4: She was like a kvetcher bird, chirping complaints all day long.
meanings.sent5: The kvetcher's constant grumbling became the soundtrack of our daily lives.

meanings.sent1: Please stop kvetching about the weather; we can't change it.
meanings.sent2: He tends to kvetch whenever things don't go his way.
meanings.sent3: The child continued to kvetch even after getting the toy he wanted.
meanings.sent4: Her car kvetched like an old engine struggling to start.
meanings.sent5: The wind kvetched through the trees, echoing the kvetcher's complaints.
